ETYMOLOGY: From Old English ofer 'above, across, beyond', from Proto-Germanic *ufer (source also of Old High German ubar, German über, Old Norse yfir), from Proto-Indo-European *uperi 'over, above' (source also of Greek hyper, Latin super).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In a position higher than something else; above.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The bird flew over the trees.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Moving across an area or surface, or from one side to another.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They talked about their plans over dinner.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们边吃晚饭边谈论计划。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: More than a particular number or amount.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这家公司有超过500名员工。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: On or covering the surface of something.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She put a cloth over the table.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她把一块布铺在桌子上。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He has authority over his team.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他对他的团队拥有权威。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word governing, and usually preceding, a noun or pronoun and expressing a relation to another word or element in the clause.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They had a disagreement over the decision.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们就这项决定产生了分歧。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: From one side or position to another; down from an upright position.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The dog rolled over and showed its belly. The old tree fell over in the storm.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 狗翻了个身，露出了肚子。老树在暴风雨中倒下了。

MEANINGS.PATTERN: the game is over | when it's over
MEANINGS.POS_TIP: An adverb modifies a verb, adjective, or another adverb. An adjective describes a noun or pronoun. Here, it functions as a predicative adjective or an adverb expressing completion.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The meeting was over by 5 PM. I'll call you when the show is over.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 会议在下午五点前结束了。演出结束后我会给你打电话。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb or a word group, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I made a mistake, so I had to do it over.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我犯了个错误，所以我不得不重做。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In cricket, a sequence of six balls bowled by one bowler from one end of the pitch.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: （板球运动中）一局（由一名投球手投掷的六个球）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He bowled a maiden over, preventing the batsmen from scoring.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他投了一个零分局，阻止了击球手得分。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: An excess or surplus (often used as 'leftover' or in the plural 'the overs').
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We had some over from the party, mostly snacks.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 派对上我们有些剩余，主要是零食。
